metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2836 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the browser engine in Mozilla Firefox before 48.0 and Firefox ESR 45.x before 45.3 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via vectors related to Http2Session::Shutdown and SpdySession31::Shutdown, and other vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2836` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xul-ext-lightning - 1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:45.3.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4').
